122001.name: Artefakt (Issue 28)
122001.description: This issue contains the universal scenario "Das Dorf der Verfemten" and the All flesh must be eaten scenario "Jäger und Gejagte"

122002.name: Gosar: Episode One
122002.description:
User Summary

Gosar is a combat game, your objective is to protect your main base while you destroy all the enemies in the area. For this, you have 6 different weapons. You control the game with the accelerometer

122003.name: Great MonkeyKing
122003.description:
User Summary

Great MonkeyKing is a game based in China’s classic novel Seoyugi (The Adventures Of Super Monkey). Wicked gangs attacked the Monkey King World and your goal is to defend it against all the enemies, also you need to protect the Buddhist scriptures.

122004.name: Ms. Pac-Man Maze Madness
122004.description:
Ms. Pac-Man Maze Madness (ミズパックマン メイズマッドネス?) is a 3D, four-directional control (block-based) puzzle game starring Ms. Pac-Man. Unlike the previous 20th Anniversary Pac-Man World, it is not a true 3D game, but uses the same format (and likely modified engine) as the mazes which could be unlocked in that game via the Galaxian doors.

PlotProfessor Pac learns that the witch, Mesmerelda, has seized control of the Enchanted Castle using black magic and from there is planning on stealing all four Gems of Virtue (Generosity; Truth; Wisdom; Courage) to control the "four wonders" (areas of Pac-Land). He creates a device called a Pactrometer which allows Ms. Pac-Man to go to these areas to recover the gems before Mesmerelda can get them first.

Source: Wikipedia, "Ms. Pac-Man Maze Madness", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

122005.name: Troll
122005.description:
User Summary

An action adventure game in which a Troll must collect crystals while avoiding Goblins and their deadly touch. The Troll has holes in his pockets, which he can throw on the floor to warp himself to a new chamber, or to trap a goblin. The game manual says:

"HUMGRUFFIN, a large and amiable Troll, has accidentally stumbled into the netherworld of Narc, an eldritch land of crystal caverns populated by a race of manically malevolant Goblins. Knowing his only chance of escape is to reverse the spell that put him in such a predicament, he realises that this can be done by taking the key crystal from each chamber and placing each one in its amulet."

Published by Palace Software, later sold as a budget by Kixx.

122006.name: 20000 Avant J.C.
122006.description:
User Summary

An arcade-adventure in which the Ka, a famous secret agent is sent back in time to 20000BC in order to collect a sample of a bacteria which is causing a violent epidemic in his timeline. The sample is made of three atoms which must be collected on order to finish the game.

20000 Avant J.C. is the first game in the "Les aventures du KA" series.

122007.name: Guido Buchwald's WM-Fun
122007.description:
Objective: score most goals - try to keep your goal clean
- acting by turns -
roll the die, move, draw action cards, manipulate playing time, participate in a soccer camp, move to substitutes' bench, challenge other players with penalty shootout...
game ends at the end of the second half or if one player scores 24 goals

remarks:
Guido Buchwald is a former German soccer player

122008.name: Le Crepuscule du Naja
122008.description:
User Summary

Second game in the Ka series. The gameplay is the same, travel from screen to screen collecting objects and battling or avoiding monsters and obstacles as you go. The back of the box says (translated from French):

"Sent by your government deep inside the Jungle, you must put an end to the terrible threat that looms over Asia, but the way is long and it won't be easy to reach the beast's lair."

122009.name: SNK vs Capcom: Match of the Millennium

videogameversion.158425: North American Neo Geo Pocket Color edition

122009.description:
SNK vs. Capcom: The Match of the Millennium (Japanese: 頂上決戦最強ファイターズ ＳＮＫ　ＶＳ．ＣＡＰＣＯＭ Hepburn: Chōjō Kessen Saikyō Fighters SNK vs. Capcom?, "Final Great Battle of the Strongest Fighters: SNK vs. Capcom") is a fighting game for the Neo Geo Pocket Color. It features a total of 26 characters from SNK and Capcom, eight of which are hidden. Play options includes 2-fighter tag teams, 3-fighter queue teams, and of course, one-on-one. After that, the player can choose either a Capcom-style level gauge, an SNK-style charge gauge, or a 'neutral' meter that enhances super attacks if full.
Every character also has a rival, whom they will fight at the fourth stage. The last two stages has the player fighting the tag team of Geese and Bison, then, depending what the side opposite to the player character's is, Orochi Iori or Evil Ryu.
As a side feature, there is Olympic mode, where one can play themed minigames such as blasting Martians FPS-style (lifted from the final boss of Metal Slug 2) or helping Arthur from Ghosts 'n Goblins hop pits to snatch up treasure, as well as there being time-attack, first strike, and survival events. The player's performance in these games awards the player special vs. points which can be used to unlock a special attack for each character.
The Match of the Millennium is capable of linking with such other games as the Card Fighters Clash series and even the Dreamcast version of Capcom vs. SNK, but the only purpose this serves is data transfer.
The use of both companies' material is quite extensive, from every character having their theme playing (not always from the first games they appeared in), to the featuring of stages from both universes. There is also interesting screens shown when this game is used in a monochrome Neo Geo Pocket, with such things as Alex and K' staring at each other, Shermie dressed up as Morrigan (to Yashiro and Chris' awe), Morrigan herself donning a suit like that of M. Bison (at which Balrog and Vega stare in embarrassment), Chun-Li doing her taunt pose while Li Xiangfei plays a Neo Geo Pocket, and Lilith and Kaede playing Neo Geo Pocket together.

Source: Wikipedia, "SNK vs. Capcom: The Match of the Millennium", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

122010.name: Le Malefice des Atlantes
122010.description:
User Summary

Third installment in the adventure of the Ka. This time our hero is sent underwater. Gameplay hasn't changed: collect objects, evade or destroy enemies, find ways around traps. The back of the box says (translated from French):

"Ever since the dawn of time two mythical realms are at war on the bottom of the oceans: the kingdom of Neptune and the Atlantean continent. Rumor has it the Atlanteans are winning, and the equilibrium maintained by the Sea God is in danger of being broken... Storms, tornadoes, tsunamis and global destruction would be the result! Only a series of challenges would save Neptune from his inaction, but none of the Neptunian champions has succeeded yet. Amphytrite, the bride of the king, decide to call upon Karl Adrix, whose fame has reached the bottom of the seas. Will he succeed where the fish-men have failed?"

122011.name: Omeyad
122011.description:
User Summary

An open-ended graphical adventure game set in medieval Araby, in a fictional town. You are Saad, a newcomer to the town and freshly admitted in the local thieves guild. As you go about your day to day business, you sense things are starting to change in town, there are rumors of an alliance between thieves and assassins, and there is talk of sorcery and strange omens. May be it is your chance to fulfill your secret fantasy, and take the place of Emir Padishah?

there are 62 different locations, and 31 different characters, each with their own goals and behavior.

122012.name: Math Cruncher
122012.description:
Math Cruncher is highly addictive math game, which you must have!
Improve your math skills, and keep your brain sharp and focused, by solving simple math equations under time pressure!

Features:
- High level HD graphics, sounds and animation.
- Part of the global Scoreloop gaming community with global leader boards and achievements.
- Work your way to global awesomeness trough several levels of difficulty.

Source: The Developer Website.

122013.name: Peur Sur Amityville
122013.description:
User Summary

A graphical adventure game inspired by the movie "The Amityville Horror". Your family has just moved into a house in Amityville. You soon find out something is haunting the house and threatening your family. It's up to you to put an end to it before it's too late.

122015.name: Destructo
122015.description:
User Summary

A budget shoot'em up. The action takes place on a single screen (no scrolling, if your plane leaves through a side of the screen it will come back through the other side). The game manual says:

"You have just seven days to prevent Dr. Destructo from carrying out his evil plans and launching a massive global attack.
Your mission is to destroy the Dr. Destructo and his island stronghold in just seven days. The buildings and fleet of the Destructo Empire are destroyed from the impact of shot down air and space craft, or by the bomb which is allocated to each player per screen. Each impact will remove a small section of the ship, island or building. When the missing sections amount to a gap through to the base, a leak is created and a water spout is formed. Most objects need three leaks in order to be successfully destroyed."

122016.name: Zero-K
122016.description:
Zero-K is a fast, competitive game with a focus on a streamlined economy and advanced interface that takes the focus off tedious tasks and back on the action. A huge roster of interesting, unique units and a variety of unit abilities provides tremendous tactical and strategic depth to the game.

Source: The Game Website.

122018.name: Colorado Cannabis Craze
122018.description:
The Colorado Cannabis Craze, a 'friendly' competition to obtain the finest quality cannabis from the four corners of Colorado and return it to Denver for sale in their shop.
A group of daring individuals will attempt this cutthroat competition to become the next Colorado Cannabis Czar. This will be no easy task! Even though medicinal marijuana is legal, the Colorado Highway Patrol (CHP), the DEA, state and local fuzz do not practice under that same opinion. Get busted and you'll spend time at the preeson in beautiful Canon City. Fly into DIA and travel to the 8 Colorado Cannabis Cities all across Colorado trying to find your old grow buddies from back in the day.

Travel different highways with pros and cons to each, visit 'turn towns' from long ago and war with other players. All have the risk of the CHP, but also test your JUJU, take chances with 'WTF?' encounters and try to Flee buy cities with your cannabis purchase in strains like Bubblegum Skunk or Colorado Kindbud. Tempt your luck with the Cripple Creek Cashout or race back to the Colorado Cannabis Connection in Denver and sell your stash to get your million and get to DIA... Get busted by Homeland Security or meet up with the hip and helpful Hilljacks in this fun and entertaining game of strategy, luck and SAFETY!!

Winning The Game:
First player reaching DIA with all 8 Cannabis City Chips and $1,000,000 is the winner...
The New Colorado Cannabis Czar!!!
Up to 6 Players with 6 ways to play!

122019.description:
Game description from the publisher:

As the political officers of the SSU, Commissar Squads have the task of enforcing the bloc's ideology. Members of this squad can be attached to other squads, or they may also be deployed as a single squad. Each commissar has either a special ability or a unique weapon to augment whatever unit he joins. Whether fielded as a unit or separated into other units, the SSU Commissar Squad is a powerful addition to your Dust Tactics and Dust Warfare army.
122019.name: Dust Tactics: SSU Commissar Squad – "Drakoni"

122020.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Airlift walkers into the thick of battle with the SSU Airborne Walker Transport. In addition to the transport, this expansion includes a modified KV-47 Walker that can be armed in three different configurations. With so many options, there is a perfect walker for any combat situation! Combining the speed of the SSU Airborne Walker Transport and the toughness of the KV-47 results in a highly effective combat tool. Quickly reinforce your forces or launch a rapid assault with this Dust Tactics and Dust Warfare expansion.
122020.name: Dust Tactics: SSU Airborne Walker Transport – "MIL MI-46 / Nastasia / Nikita / Nina"

122021.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Swift, deadly, and armed to the teeth, the SSU Ground Attack Helicopter expansion for Dust Tactics and Dust Warfare supports SSU forces with precision air strikes. Launch this machine in one of four different builds, each specializing in a different combat role. The Striker, for example, is armed with heavy machine guns and cannons, providing air superiority. Choose your armament of cannons, bombs, and rockets and unleash a salvo of destruction upon your enemy with the SSU Ground Attack Helicopter.
122021.name: Dust Tactics: SSU Ground Attack Helicopter – "Striker / Burner / Airblaster / Death Rain"

122022.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Supporting three different builds, the Panzer-Kampfläufer III adds destructive weapons and extra toughness to your Axis armies in Dust Tactics and Dust Warfare. The Flamm-Luther uses massive flamethrowers to incinerate opposing troops and vehicles. Meanwhile, the Wotan fires explosive lasers from afar, punching holes in anything in its path. With the same laser cannons as the Wotan, the Wotan-AR features heavier armor for added protection. Reinforce your army with the Panzer-Kampfäufer III expansion and devastate your enemies.
122022.name: Dust Tactics: Panzer-Kampfläufer III – "Flamm-Luther / Wotan / Wotan-AR"

122023.name: The Realm of Yolmi
122023.description:
From the RPG description here on RPGGeek.

An early science fiction RPG, the Yolmi were an evil alien race that the human PCs encountered far too often for their tastes. A level/class-based game, it includes the usual character rules as well as spaceship rules and a respectably large bestiary.

122024.name: Cosmic Supremacy
122024.description:
Cosmic Supremacy is a FREE tick/turn-based massively multiplayer space strategy game with a 3D 'Galaxy View' interface. You share a galaxy with hundreds of players each with their own alien civilization. Some of them might turn out to be your enemies, others could be your allies. You need to explore the galaxy around you, discover new solar systems, colonise new planets, and expand your empire. You can design every ship in your fleet, and research new advanced technologies so that you can build faster and stronger ships that will give you the edge in epic battles.

Source: The Developer Website.

122025.name: The Wizard's Tower
122025.description:
Publisher blurb:

This issue has 7 pages of good stuff, setting information, maps, 6 plot hooks with 3 ways to twist each them, 4 npcs, a random table of rumors and another chock full of things to find in the wizards basement.

122026.name: The Apothecary's Shop
122026.description:
User summary:

This short book presents a location, plot hooks, and system-neutral NPCs centered on a fantasy apothecary.

122027.name: The Fairy Glade
122027.description:
User summary:

A map, six plot hooks (with twists), and some system-neutral NPCs centered around a fairy glade.

122028.name: The Gambling Gryphon
122028.description:
Publisher blurb:

A small country inn that has seen the city grow up around it. A lot to see at the Gryphon; a magic horse, the halfling bouncer, and the drinks are not bad either.

122029.name: The Hermit's Island
122029.description:
Publisher blurb:

Out in the storm-lashed waters of the northwestern ocean is a small island not too far off the coast. Years ago the island was home to a monastery until the accident. After that night the monks fled the island never to return. Stories tell of a strange old hermit living on the island. Others speak of seeing camp fires in the night. What secrets does the hermit’s Island hold?

122030.name: The Secret Library of Ethos
122030.description:
Publisher blurb:

For some power comes from money, for others it comes from military might but for those who really understand the workings of the universe they know that knowledge is the fast means to power. In all the land there is no greater accumulation of knowledge then the Secret Library of Ethos.

122031.name: The Cursed Catacombs
122031.description:
Publisher blurb:

In a special supersized issue of Toys from the Sandbox we return to the Hermit’s Island. Below the ruins of the old monastery are the old catacombs that once served as a reliquary and burial chamber for the monks who made their home on the island. Now filled and consumed with a dark energy these caverns have many secrets, some of which may soon reach the mainland.

Come along with us and explore them in Toys for the Sandbox #6: The Cursed Catacombs.

122032.name: The Coachman's Inn
122032.description:
Publisher blurb:

The Grillina Crossroads is situated between 4 powerful kingdoms, after years of warfare the crossroads sits at the center of a buffer zone. The only permanent structure allowed according to the treaty is the Coachman’s Inn. This has not stopped a slew of less permanent structures from springing up and forming a tent city and bustling market around the inn.

In this issue of Toys for the Sandbox we explore the inn and the tent city with map, 6 plot hooks each with 3 ways to twist them, 4 NPCs, a random table of rumors and another table of random items your party might find on sale in the market.

122033.name: The Druid's Grove
122033.description:
Publisher blurb:

High along the eastern face of the Grestilian Mountains sits the druid’s most sacred grove. The Moonsong Grove is home to an order of druids that oversee the grove and mediate disputes between other druidic orders. According to legend this grove contains the first spark of fire, the first breath of wind, the first drops of water and the first oak.

This issue of Toys from the sandbox comes with two maps, 4 npcs, 16 plot hooks, a list of rumors about the grove and a bit of history on the grove.

122034.name: Dormant Volcano
122034.description:
Publisher blurb:

From the steamy green of the southern Jungle the long dormant volcanic cone of Mount Nordelith rises. This once fiery mountain holds many secrets including a shipwreck, tales of the Ghost Dragon and a flying squirrel with a problem.

In the 9th issue of Toys for the Sandbox our exploration of this dormant volcano reveals flavor text, maps, 6 adventure hooks with 3 twists, a list of rumors and possible encounters.

122035.name: Rolling Ranch
122035.description:
Nothing is as it seems on the Rolling Ranch. Help farmer Earp bring his animals inside the barn. Be careful there is something growing on the ranch.

Hurry up and do not waste your shots in the fun billiard style game. As you get the animals into the barn through a field of obstacles!

Nothing is as it seems in the Rolling Ranch.

Just play it and find out what's behind the creepy obstacles.

FEATURES

80 specially designed levels will test your skills
Earn medals and achievements as you unlock levels.
Multiple solutions and stars ratings on each level.
Simple and intuitive touch controls.
Fun graphics everyone can enjoy
Full screen display support.
Available on the iPad and iPhone.
Free updates every month!




Source: The Game Website.

122036.name: Homicidal Transients
122036.description:
Publisher blurb:

You've played a thousand different roleplaying games before, but what winds up being the same thing time and time again? Your characters are almost always homeless and engage in altercations that usually wind up being life or death matters. Or, as it was simply put in a conversation on gaming: adventurers are usually some sort of transient murderhobo.

That's the core concept behind Homicidal Transients. You and your gang wander aimlessly and kill things to get their stuff. Sometimes it's just money, sometimes it's a bottle or two of booze, maybe some magic. Any way you cut it, the stuff is yours now, and it's time to move on to the next place that you can get stuff.

The original game mechanics are designed to allow for any kind of dice you have. If you need to raid your board games for 6-sided dice, you'll be just as able to play as someone who has a 50 pound bucket of dice to sort through. A whole group at the table could get away with playing using just one pencil, a piece of paper, and one die with few complications. It's that simple to pick up and play this game.

What's better than a handful of friends sitting around and pretend murdering fake monsters for their imaginary stuff?

122037.name: Blind World
122037.description:
User Summary

In this simple puzzle game, the level is at first invisible - but by manipulating a small ball, and your iOS device, you gradually reveal the level's underlying shape. You completely the level when you have uncovered every object and wall.

Programmed by Dmitriy Kuzmenko.

122038.name: Katamari Amore
122038.description:
User Summary

Katamari Damacy for the iPhone and iPad! This game features 6 levels (with all IAPs), including many that do not appear in any other Katamari game. Control the prince with dual stick or the iOS device's accelerometer.

This game requires the iPhone 3GS, iPhone4, iPod touch 3rd generation, iPod touch 4th generation, iPad, or iPad2.

122039.name: Round the Houses
122039.description:
From the rules:
"Two lifetimes ago, there were no cars, trains, motor cycles or even bicycles. Horses carried people on their backs, pulled coaches, carriages and wagons. Horses were everywhere and did everything. Mail coaches carried letters and parcels; stagecoaches, post chaises, wagons and carts carried passengers between towns and cities. Horses were changed at Inns and passengers were collected, rested and fed. If you walk around the old parts of our towns and cities you will see the old Inns with their arched entrances and courtyards. Their names often remind us of their coaching past."

A simple roll-and-move game where your "coach" has to go round the board and collect a passenger from each four Inns. There are a few squares that make you miss your turn or go back, and "horse bolts down the lane" squares that make you go to the other side of the board.

122040.name: Dreadfleet Captains

rpgpodcastepisode.101205: Die Söhne Sigmars bringen den Frühling

122040.description:
From the publisher's website:

For two bleak decades the Undead reavers of Count Noctilus have plagued the oceans of the world. And yet there remains hope; Captain Jaego Roth has vowed to hunt down and destroy the Undead captains once and for all, and with him stand the most notorious and cunning of the pirate lords of Sartosa. But even as these legendary figures prepare to do battle, destiny has a role for the most unlikely of heroes. Will you rise to the challenge?

This exciting 40-card pack lets players bring the memorable characters of Games Workshop’s Dreadfleet to their WFRP campaigns with nearly a dozen new NPCs. Learn of quests from Captain Jaego Roth, parlay with The Golden Magus, or engage in combat with Count Noctilus himself. With Dreadfleet Captains, the choice is yours.

With new Creature cards, Action cards, Location cards, and more, Dreadfleet Captains features a host of new narrative options. Will your party hunt Sartosa’s shadowy pubs for rumours leading to Aranessa Anja Saltspite, or seek an audience with Prince Yrellian of Ulthuan? Wherever your adventures take you, you’ll have the cards and components you need to bring a piece of Dreadfleet’s action to your story.

Dreadfleet Captains includes:

10 Creature Cards
10 ActionCards
6 Location Cards
10 Character Standup Cards

122041.name: A Copa da Árvore

2378.name: Copag - Cia. Paulista de Artes Gráficas

122041.description:
Plant fruits and flowers, grow your tree with branches and roots and build the most complete forest!

Players start with just one trunk and should grown it and/or create more trees. Manage your hand and buy the cards available to choose between a tree filled with fruits or a tree with flowers.

The more you collect of one kind of fruit, the more you are rewarded, but beware, some branches have a bird nest or a snake! Birds fly around the trees, attacking and eating their fruits, unless the tree is protected by a snake.

The "Crown of the Tree" is a fun strategy game for children and adults. Includes a card with a real seed to plant.

122042.name: Uncharted: Golden Abyss

videogamehonor.31916: 2011 Game Critics Best Handheld Game of the Year Nominee

122042.description:
Uncover the dark secret behind the 400-year-old massacre of a Spanish expedition as Nathan Drake follows the murderous trail of an ancient and secret Spanish sect. Caught in the middle of a rivalry between Jason Dante - his old friend - and Marisa Chase - the granddaughter of an archeologist who has mysteriously vanished without a trace - Nathan Drake races into the treacherous river basins, undiscovered temple ruins and karst caverns of Central America in search of a legendary lost city, only to find himself pushed to the edge of the Golden Abyss.

Source: The Game Website.

122043.name: GiFTPiA
122043.description:
GiFTPiA is a video game that was developed by Skip Ltd. for the Nintendo GameCube. It was released in Japan on April 25, 2003. Despite that its last showing at Electronic Entertainment Expo (E3) was in English, Nintendo cancelled the North American localization of GiFTPiA. In English, the game would most likely be better understood as called "Giftopia" to represent the two words, gift and utopia.

GiFTPiA follows the protagonist Pockle, a resident of Nanashi Island, who, on the day of his coming of age ceremony, oversleeps and misses the whole thing. The mayor of the island, Mayer, is so incensed that he orders Pokkle's arrest and a fine of five million "Mane" (the game's currency) to recoup the costs of the event. Thus, it is up to Pockle to work off his huge debt. At the game's start, Pockle must cope with heavy restrictions: an early curfew, a ball & chain, having his face pixelated and a robot police chief named Mappo. Throughout his adventure, Pockle is assisted by his dog Tao and his girlfriend Kyappa. There is also a large cast of supporting characters that live on Nanashi Island and interact with Pockle, including a bartender that goes by Peevee and a radio DJ called DEEJ. Pockle eventually encounters an old man who will give him some mushroom soup and teach him about other paths to adulthood via helping others.

GiFTPiA is similar to Nintendo's Animal Crossing in that both games place an emphasis on interacting with other characters. In order to meet the game's five million Mane requirement, the player must initially take menial jobs such as fishing, collecting fruit, or repairing signs. After meeting the old man, the player must travel the island, collecting its residents' wishes, and fulfill them. However, the player has numerous restrictions that are lifted as the game progresses. For instance, if the player stays out after curfew, ghosts will chase Pockle to his house. If he does not make it back, he will be put to sleep, making him vulnerable to theft. The player is also responsible for making Pockle eat, as he will otherwise starve to death.

Source: Wikipedia, "GiFTPiA", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

122044.name: Snowpack Park
122044.description:
Snowpack Park is a WiiWare game starring your own Mii character and a whole colony of lovable penguins. Feed them, play games with them, and venture outside of the park to find more penguins!

A blizzard has hit Snowpack Park and scattered the colony of penguins that live there. Your job is to bring the colony back together and keep the penguins happy. This is not an easy task, as you'll face obstacles like piles of snow, angry seals, runaway penguins, and more. With the help of one odd-looking penguin, you will be capable of accomplishing your mission.

Snowpack Park is available for download through the WiiWare service on the Wii Shop Channel.

Source: The Game Website.

122045.name: Tenopia Island
122045.description:
User summary:

A young space traveler is trapped on the mysterious planet of Tenopia, and must escape. In this, the first book in the series, you find yourself on the island of Tenopia.

122046.name: Trapped in the Sea Kingdom
122046.description:
User summary:

In the second book of the Escape from Tenopia series of Choose Your Own Adventure-style books, your character receives gill impants and must escape from a strange undersea realm on the planet of Tenopia.

122047.name: Terror on Kabran
122047.description:
User summary:

In the third book of the Choose Your Own Adventure-style Escape from Tenopia series, you've made it to Kabran but must now locate the galactic patrol station that will let you return home.

122048.name: Star System Tenopia
122048.description:
User summary:

In the final book in the Choose Your Own Adventure-style Escape from Tenopia series, you've finally commandeered a starship and must now escape from the Tenopia System so that you can return home.

122049.name: iKungFu Master
122049.description:
User Summary

iKungFu Master is a scrolling combat game. Your beloved has been kidnapped and she is being held for ransom. Fortunately you are a Kung Fu master and you plan to save her with your fists. Your goal is to travel to the underworld and fight all the thugs that cross in your path.

122050.name: Puzzle Menu
122050.description:
Party game. Each guest is given a card with 41 clues to something. The only help is that every answer relates to a course in a meal. So you start with Hors D'Ouvre and then Soup, and so on.

The guest with the most right answers, wins

122051.name: iThunderStrike
122051.description:
User Summary

iThunderStrike is scrolling shooting game. You control a very lethal helicopter and you are the last hope to stop the alien invaders. Your goal is to wipe them all. The game features more than 40 different enemies and end of mission bosses.

122052.name: Matchs
122052.description:
User Summary

Matchs is a puzzle game for one or two players. Several matchsticks are placed in a line and you have to remove one or more matches in your turn, if you remove the last one you lose!.

122053.name: TV Manager 2 Expansion pack
122053.description:
Expansion pack / Premium edition:
• Maps of the UK, Germany and France
• Three additional scenarios (expert mode, tweaked 24 turns and custom scenario)
• Movie, ad and news editors to create your own content
• 100 additional movies to choose from
• Upgrade fully compatible to the BigFishGames edition

Booster cards pack:
• 20 unique booster cards, which you can use to modify and tweak the gameplay.
• No trading card game, no unfair advantages.
• Purely optional. Can be turned off anytime.
• For example: Play a TV channel focused only on news.
• Upgrade fully compatible to the BigFishGames edition

Source: The Publisher Website.

122054.name: Bridge Crew (Best Friends Version)
122054.description:
From publisher blurb:

This scenario uses the Best Friends rules but puts them into quite a different setting, though still one that is very apt. Bridge Crew is a popular, if somewhat cheesy, space opera about exploring new frontiers and contacting strange alien races (in other words, it’s classic Star Trek from a parallel universe). On-screen, the characters form a happy family who, though they may occasionally argue, will always risk their lives for each other.
Off-screen, the actors are a bunch of self-centred, bitchy prima donnas who are only interested in the size of their dressing room, the amount of exposure they get and boffing fans on the set under the guise of getting them into the show as an extra.
The players take on both sides as they try to create a classic episode of Bridge Crew and hence insure the series getting renewed, whilst also each making sure that they personally are top of the tree.

122055.description: An expansion to the game Masterquiz from 1985. This expansion contains 3000 new questions and a deck of special cards which the players can use strategically during the course of the game. The players get 7 special cards each from start. The game is played in the same manor as Masterqiz, but the special cards gives the opportunity to duel against other players, take a 2nd guess, choose category etc.
122055.name: Masterquiz II

122056.name: Best Friends (2nd Edition)
122056.description:
From publisher blurb:

Best Friends is a role-playing game about girlfriends and their petty hatreds. You all role-play girlfriends of each other and gameplay involves who you hate for being prettier than you, richer than you, etc.

Being "Best Friends"
So, what’s this book all about?

Well, it’s a role-playing game about being a girl.

Yeah, everyone plays a girl. If you’re not down with that then, y’know, just put Best Friends back wherever you found it and walk away. No hard feelings, eh?

So, still here? Great!

OK, it’s a game about being Best Friends and all the little hatreds that Best Friends have for each other.

Oh, I know. You’re gonna say that y’all get along just peachy. Well, that’s ﬁne too. No one said any of this was true…

But, between you and me: it really is.

Anyway, you and some friends all play girlfriends and try to do stuﬀ together, while secretly hating each other. And getting little frissons of excitement out of getting one up on your Best Friends. And it’s going to be fun.

122058.name: Best Friends (1km1kt Edition)
122058.description:
From Introduction:

being best friends
So, what’s this book all about?

Well, it’s a role-playing game about being a girl.

Yeah, everyone plays a girl. If you’re not down with that then just put best friends back wherever you found it and walk away. No hard feelings, eh?

So, still here?

OK, it’s a game about being best friends and all the little hatreds that best friends have for each other.

Oh, I know. You’re gonna say that y’all get along just peachy. Well, that’s fine too. No one said any of this was true.

But, between you and me: it probably is.

Anyway, you and some friends all play girlfriends and try to do stuff together while secretly hating each other. And getting little frissons of excitement out of getting one up on your best friends.

122059.name: War Machine
122059.description:
User Summary

A run n'gun budget game in which you must destroy the aliens invading a base and collect the four parts of the secret weapon you need to destroy the alien queen. The back of the box says:

"Seriously destructive combat action. The Alien queen and her breeders must die. If you fail her legions will swarm across this system bringing a wave of death and destruction in their wake.
As one of our most experienced combat marines, you have been selected for this very dangerous mission. You've been issued with an extremely powerful plasma blaster and impact grenades. Your main objective: Destroy the alien base.
WAR MACHINE features legions of technomilitary adversaries, evil bio-mechanoid blood suckers and armour stripping acid baths."

122060.name: Pharaon
122060.description:
User Summary

A graphical text adventure game in which you are an american archaeologist searching for the lost tomb of Acktheon, the Anti-Matter Pharoh. It is rumoured that the secrets of anti-matter have been buried with the pharaoh and whoever finds the tomb first will have great powers. To complicate matters, your jealous colleague Yvan Skivol is on your trail, and won't hesitate to kill you if you get in his way.

The game uses digitized graphics, and includes arcade sequences (a space invader minigame when you're buying equipment, and two first-person mazes to explore during the game).

122061.name: Honour the Chapter
122061.description:
From the back of the book
Deathwatch
Honour the Chapter
An unprecedented gathering of the Emperor's Finest

For ten millennia, Space Marines from a thousand chapters have fought and died in the name of the Emperor of Man. Stand beside your Battle-Brothers and wield your wrath against the enemies.

Play a Battle-Brother from on of over twenty Space Marine Chapters, including the stalwart Crimson Fists, the noble Blood Ravens, and the mysterious Legion of the Damned.

Wield powerful relics of your chapter and unleash the power of ancient artefacts to smite your foes.
Bear them with righteousness that your deeds might be remembered beside those of age past.

Explore ancient alliances and bitter rivalries as you make war on the enemies of man throughout the Jericho Reach.

Take your place among the legends of the Adeptus Astartes!

A copy of the Deathwatch Core Rulebook is needed to use this supplement.

From the publisher's website:
“Today we face those who betrayed our predecessors. Today we bring death to those who turned from the light of the Emperor and broke faith with their brothers. Today we bring honour to those who came before us as we lay low these traitors! For Vilamus! For Guilliman! For the Emperor!"
–Brother-Captain Haeron of the Marines Errant

The brethren of the Deathwatch are the champions of humanity, the elite of the elite, and the very best the thousand and more Chapters of the Adeptus Astartes can produce. But while many Battle-Brothers are drawn from the most well known Chapters—the Blood Angels, the Space Wolves, the Ultramarines, and others of the First Founding—still more hail from lesser known bodies, the Successors of the great Legions. Some of these Chapters are every bit as famous as their celebrated progenitors, while others are all but unheralded. Nevertheless, all are heroes.

Honour the Chapter provides a wealth of options for players interested in characters drawn from Chapters created during the Second or subsequent Foundings. This comprehensive tome contains new character creation rules, a wealth of relics unique to each Chapter, and plenty of guidance and adventure seeds for Game Masters.

122062.name: Profession Detective
122062.description:
User Summary

A graphical detective adventure, entirely menu-driven, with black and white graphics in high resolution. The player is a private investigator hired to rescue a kidnapped child.

122063.name: Kat Trap
122063.description:
User Summary

A run n'gun game in which the player leads a combat robot against an army of Cat Men. The concept was the winning entry in a game design contest organized by Crash Magazine. The back of the box says:

"Two hundred years ago the planet Earth was wrecked by Solar explosions. The lucky few who escaped have spent their time rebuilding the human population, and the offspring have returned to their homeland - only to find it plagued by the Cat Men!

M.T.-E.D. is put in the forward battle line to blast his way through a heavy array of mutant robots and destroy the central battle computer. He is alone except for a guiding force - you! Can you help him out-wit the Cat Men? Get your finger on the button for the first round!"

122064.name: Rat Connection
122064.description:
User Summary

A graphical text adventure game in which a private investigator tries to find his kidnapped secretary. Don't forget to put some clothes on before leaving your office, as exhibitionism is punishable by death in Rat City!

122065.name: Robinson Crusoe
122065.description:
User Summary

A graphical adventure game adaptation of the famous novel. The game is played like a gamebook, by selecting from the available actions.

122066.name: Sauvez Yurk
122066.description:
User Summary

A graphical adventure game in which you and Yurk the dragon are trapped in Hell and must find three magical crystals in order to escape. The game is icon-driven and has 47 different screens.

122067.name: SDAW
122067.description:
User Summary

A graphical post-apocalyptic adventure game in which an combat android investigates the sewers of a destroyed city in search of a doomsday weapon. The game is icon-driven. The back of the box says (translated from French):

"July 26, 2194, 4 years after the beginning of the third world war, a nuclear bomb detonates over Chicago, destroying the last remnants of earth civilization. A new life begins: these wastelands become the ground over which a neverending war between mutants and survivors rages. The war would have already been lost by the last human if they had not created SDAW, a perfect android.
He's their only chance of defeating the mutants and create a new world. Alas, the mutants are also preparing for the final battle: on March 24, 2245 they deploy a new weapon of horrifying power.
SDAW's mission is to infiltrate the sewers where the weapon is kept, and destroy it. But what if it's already too late?"

122068.name: Message From Andromeda
122068.description:
User Summary

A graphical science-fiction text adventure. The back of the box says:

"You are the captain of the space patrol cruiser galaxy. While on routine patrol, you receive a distress signal originating from a previously unknown planet. Your mission is to investigate the source of the signal.
A word of warning though: your mission is fraught with danger and things may not be all they seem. Be prepared for the unexpected. This is the first of the adventures in the galaxy series."

122069.name: Land of Enin
122069.description:
You've grown up with the outrageous tales of your forefathers - your Uncle Jack, the golden goose thief, your Mother’s 2nd cousin Jack the Giant Teaser and Lima Bean Eater and Grandpa Jack who had that thing about jumping over candlesticks. And now it’s your turn to set out and find fortune in the Land of Enin. One fateful day an enchanted sheep (or pig, you are not quite clear on the details, all those enchanted talking animals look alike after awhile) saunters up and tells you about a Lost Book of Magic that will gain you a kingdom of your own, if only you can find it.

To win this solitaire game you must:
first, steal a key from the town elders,
and sweet talk a watchword from an old witch woman,
then rescue a maiden from a goblin tower,
then return her to her royal father
who will give you a magic lodestone
to find your way through the Tombs of Neuve and
search for the Lost Book
and win you your kingdom!
all while battling monsters a'plenty, finding treasure and
magic items and generally questing about!

Needed to Play:
the 9 Land of Enin cards
(or the player sheet if you are
playing the mini-mini version)
1D6 and 1D10 (2D10 is even better)
10 black wooden cubes
2 yellow wooden cubes
1 red, blue and green wooden cube
and 1 Meeple o’Adventure

Play:
Each turn consists of 2 phases: Travel and Questing.

Travel Phase
During the Travel Phase, roll 1D10 to determine where you move
to. Each Location Card, in the lower right, lists which of the other Locations you can move to depending on what number you roll. A roll of 0 allows you to choose any location.

Questing Phase
During the Questing Phase, roll 1D10 and, on the chart on the
Location Card, find the action which matches the rolled number.
Encounters result in a further 1D10 roll on a matching Encounter
Card.

Combat:
If you encounter a monster, during the Questing Phase, you must
fight it in combat. Different monsters are encountered based on
your current experience level.

The land of Enin is a fast and fun dice game for one player.

122070.name: Saga
122070.description:
User Summary

French fantasy RPG. The game can be played by one player, or two players using a vertically split screen. The game can be played either cooperatively or competitively. The game system uses classic character classes (wizard, warrior, paladin, assassin, elf, priest) with different stat scores (the stats are strength, agility, intelligence, luck, hit points, magic points), and the characters get better as they gain experience points. The back of the box says (translated from French):

"XIIIth Century

"Heprena is dying, you must help my people!"

This message will turn your peaceful ligfe upside down. Heprena... The glorious city and home of your former tutor, Merlux, Master Enchanter. Leaving your enchanted forest, you go into the unknown... Before you find Merlux, your quest will be filled with challenges:

- labyrinths,
- deadly pirates,
- bloodthirsty brigands,
- gargoyles and zombies.

You'll hear from his mouth of the Evil that rules over Heprena, and the nature of your mission..."

122071.name: U-Boot
122071.description:
User Summary

U-Boot is a side-scrolling game in which you navigate a submarine through treacherous waters by tilting your iOS device. You can also shoot torpedoes and control your speed in order to avoid dangerous obstacles and collect bonuses and power-ups.

122072.name: HERO System Martial Arts (HD Character Pack)
122072.description:
User Summary

The characters, abilities, styles, and templates from HERO System Martial Arts in Hero Designer format.

User Notes

Hero Designer is a piece of software that greatly simplifies the creation of HERO System content by providing templates, error-checking, and a full set of powers, skills, etc., and more.

Hero fans (usually uncredited) often volunteer to turn content from HERO System titles into Hero Designer format. No artwork is included in HD Character Packs.

122073.name: To-Fu: The Trials of Chi
122073.description:
User Summary

You play To-Fu: a springy, stretchy hunk of tofu who happens to be the world's foremost martial arts expert. To-Fu has been chosen to participate in the deadly Trials of Chi: 150 levels of that take advantage of his unique physical properties to avoid deadly obstacles and pick up all the chi globes that he can.

The basic game mechanic takes advantage of To-Fu's physical stretchiness. To move him, you pull him back on the touch screen and then snap him into position.

122074.name: To-Fu 2
122074.description:
User Summary

The sequel to To-Fu: The Trials of Chi. The stretchy hunk of tofu (who happens to be the world's foremost martial arts expert) has returned! This time he sports an all-new Super Ping move and 115 all-new, brain-bending levels.

In addition, a new Time Trial mode allows you to collect Chi within a certain time limit and then compare your results to your GameCenter friends.

Finally, in the new To-Fu Store, you can purchase outfits and other goodies for To-Fu and his companions.

122075.name: ContiTireRace: The Continental Racing Game
122075.description:
User Summary

This game was a promotion for a tire: the Continental ContiWinterContactTM TS 830. You play the tire itself (not the full car - just the tire), and the game simulates the tire's traction and braking performance on a variety of surfaces.

The entire simulation is wrapped in a race game, where you essentially run time trials through a course with multiple types of terrain.

122076.name: ContiTireRace 2: The Continental Racing Game
122076.description:
User Summary

This game was a promotion for a tire: the Continental ContiSportContact™ 5 . You play the tire itself (not the full car - just the tire), and the game simulates the tire's traction and braking performance on a variety of surfaces.

The entire simulation is wrapped in a race game, where you essentially run time trials through a course with multiple types of terrain.

122077.name: Fitting & Proper
122077.description:
Fitting & Proper is a puzzle game, one in a small line published by Springbok. There are 36 plastic pegs which are randomly placed in an 8x8 grid of holes, and 16 L-shaped plastic pieces with holes in various places into which the pegs fit.

If played as a solitaire puzzle, the object is to fit all 16 pieces on the grid. In the two-player version, the players divide the pieces equally and try to be the last to be able to place a piece.

122078.name: Line Rider

videogamehonor.32381: 2007 Game Developers Choice Awards Best Innovation of the Year Winner

122078.description:
User Summary

Line Rider is a physics game featuring a man on a sled. Draw lines and watch your man on a sled ride down the line following the laws of physics. Try to hit your own goals and make fantastic pictures!

122079.name: Breakthrough
122079.description:
A conversational card game in the vein of Scruples. The game features three levels of cards, blue, yellow, and red. The red cards are considered the most daring. Before the game, the players agree on which level cards to use (only blue, blue and yellow, or all three).

Each player draws one card per round. In turn, you can choose to answer the question by passing the card to another player, who reads the question back to you and you give your answer. Alternatively, you can challenge, where you will answer the question if another player answers it first. A third option is to pass and not answer the question.

Answered questions give 1 point for a blue card, 2 points for a yellow card and 3 points for a red card. After answering, each player can give you 2 bonus points if you revealed something they did not know about you. Alternatively, if another player feels you went all out to answer the question, displaying honesty and bravery beyond the call of duty, they can say "breakthrough" and you get 3 bonus points.

Game is played to a pre-determined time limit where the most points wins (or a set number of points can be used).

122080.name: Wrasslin' Manager
122080.description:
In Wrasslin 'Manager, players, managers from now, handle to a single wrestler (gimmick) to wrestling of the WWA (World Wrestling Association) for a full season of wrestling.

During the season, managers have the opportunity to learn new moves to his fighters and special moves or improve their stats or their recovery from training events, while you as a manager, you can learn new strategies that interfere in a fight.

Managers use their best wrestler to compete with them in clashes that represent the highlights of the events pay-per-view of the WWA, the decisive moments and full of action they are looking forward to seeing the fans! If one of your fighters has a good performance at a show, you get more fans and hardcore fans, which is the target to any aspiring professional wrestler: the glory.

122081.name: Scheherazade y la Lámpara Maravillosa
122081.description:
Scheherazade and the Wonderful Lamp is a cooperative-narrative game in which players create an amazing story using cards that show concepts or narrative elements of the fairy tales themselves.

Players must work together to tell an amazing story cooperative, incorporating ideas from other players on their own, so that will be spinning a nice adventure. On each turn, the active player Scheherazade, and as a storyteller create or continue an amazing story using the elements of his cards, trying to steer the argument towards a happy ending.

The goal of the game is that players have fun and tell a good story. Players will win if they can tell different stories entirely successful four (one of each color).

122082.name: Memento Mori
122082.description:
In this card game for 1 or 2 players from the hour objective is simple, you progress in your cursus honorum, your political career during the Roman Republic in the first century BC, living to tell, and be finally proclaimed Emperor of Rome.

We traveled back in time to the glorious Roman Republic, following the footsteps of statesmen and its ruling elite. In Memento mori assume the role of leader of a patrician family in a power struggle that will decide if Jupiter gives its approval, the fate of Rome, and the Known World!.

In an abstract way, over your long life, events or developments will be happening very important and permeated Roman society that affect you directly or indirectly, and will have to make important decisions for your political career as your goal is to become Emperor of Rome, but your political rival, belonging to another patrician family expects the same, and make every effort to come on or get tripped up. In order to be proclaimed Emperor of Rome must overcome dangers and betrayals in the turbulent waters of politics in the Senate, and find faithful allies among the patricians to rely in order to get their votes and support.

122083.name: The War of Worlds
122083.description:
The War of the Worlds is a game for icehouse, based on the eponymous science fiction novel written by HG Wells, first published in 1898, describing a Martian invasion of Earth and the terrible battle that has to fight the humanity to survive.

The War of the Worlds is an abstract strategy board game designed for the icehouse system that requires reflection and large doses of tactics and strategy. The game board in the form of "L" represents the Earth. A player will command the alien invasion (green pyramids), while his opponent take the human resistance (yellow pyramids).

To win, each player must be removing the pyramids (units and war machines) of his adversary, for whom he finally finished the game with as many of their pyramids live on Earth. Your opponent will know things get tough?

122084.name: Best Friends GenCon 2007 Demo
122084.description:
From Introduction:

Best Friends is a role-playing game about girlfriends and all their petty hatreds.

You play a group of best friends and, like all best friends, you have petty little hatreds for each other.

You also have Stuff and Nonsense that drive the game, and your hatreds are used to resolve the conflicts.

122085.name: The Soul Reaver
122085.description:
From the Publisher's website:
The Dark Eldar are a plague upon the Koronus Expanse. Any who cross the Maw and sail the void of the Koronus Expanse learn to fear the wicked silhouettes of their ships and their seemingly endless cruelty towards all life, including their own. Only vigilance and firepower keep the worst depredations of these terrible raiders at bay. Do you have the courage to face them in the name of the Emperor?

The Soul Reaver, an adventure in three parts for Rogue Trader, presents a chance for daring Explorers to look deep into the twisted heart of Dark Eldar society in the Koronus Expanse, where they’ll attempt the greatest heist of their careers! This, along with a new playable xenos Career Path, the Dark Eldar Kabalite Warrior, offers players useful content long after the adventure concludes.

122086.name: Dog Towns
122086.description:
From publisher blurb:

In 2007, at the Milton Keynes Role Playing Group, we played a short campaign of Dogs in the Vineyard, round robin style, with each participant taking it in turn to be in the hot seat as GM for a session while the rest played their Dogs and sorted out the town the GM had prepared for us. It was very successful and a lot of fun and if you're thinking about running a Dogs camapign yourself, it's the format I'd recommend.
Here are the two towns I created and ran for the round robin; enjoy.

From HAGEN’S BASIN – “MUDSLIDE”:
When the Faithful settled this peaceful little spot in the foothills at the base of the great mountain range that cuts them off from the East, they assisted a family of the Mountain People is binding an evil spirit at the bottom of the lake from which the town now takes it name. The Mountain People were so impressed with the powerful medicine of the Faithful that they converted en masse to the Faith. As a result, Hagen’s Basin is composed roughly 50/50 of those of European descent and the Mountain People, as well as some individuals of mixed descent: not everyone welcomes this…

From LASKEY’S CROSSING – “THE ENEMY OF FAITH”:

20 years ago: Malcolm Trumbull had an affair with his brother’s wife back east many years ago: there was a minor scandal and Malcolm moved west, where he has survived and grown prosperous with his investments. He is the richest man in Laskey’s Crossing and has title to nearly all the land thereabouts.
10 years ago: the ‘pox visited Laskey’s Crossing, killing many of the children; Isaac Leominster was 8 at the time and his younger sister, Bethany, was 5. Medicine was procured, but too late for Bethany who died of the illness: Isaac survived with a ‘pox scarred face.
Now: Jennifer Trumbull is a smart, plain young woman with a passion for art & science: she is the daughter of Malcolm Trumbull, but believes that he is her uncle. She has moved west to Laskey’s Crossing at his invitation, in order to teach the older children some culture & reason: Malcolm believes in investing in the future.

122087.name: Is This Seat Taken?
122087.description:
From publisher blurb:

At one of the hottest spots in Al Amarja’s nightlife, an agent seeks out their contact in order to transfer a package, unaware that agents of an opposing conspiracy are watching and waiting to intercept the exchange... This being The Edge, however, things are nowhere near that simple.
A game of secrecy, betrayal, confusion, large crowds and speed dating for up to 8 players, this involves lots of standing as there are intended to be fewer seats than players! Being able to sit or choosing to stand are vital parts of the game and affect what your character can do.
This is the first of two 'party games' set on Al Amarja using the Over the Edge rules and is intended for use at conventions or any other situation where you have a lot of players who want a fun game quickly.

122088.name: Out of the Inkwell
122088.description:
From publisher blurb:

The long awaited sequel to Is This Seat Taken? Only it's not really got anything to do with that, except that it uses an NPC as one of the PCs... and it was actually written before "Is This Seat Taken?" anyway. Confused yet? Then read on!

The cult comic creator Wilbur Fields has been invited as guest of honour to a convention held on the Mediterranean island of Al Amarja. His agent is there with him to make a movie deal with the representative of a local company and the fans have turned up in force for the Q&A session. Some of the questions that will arise, however, are things that should never have been asked and no-one is going to like the answers…
Another Over the Edge party game for 4 to 8 players, plus a GM.

122090.name: Tech Powers
122090.description:
Publisher's Blurb:

From heavy metal to sleek high-tech, Tech Powers takes a look at the abilities of machines and those who control them. Create a hero with a Machine Body and a Digital Mind, or with the power to Interface with computers and communicate over the world network. Animate machines or operate them from a distance, or exercise intuitive powers of invention. The powers in this Profile let you build a better hero, literally! This product is for Mutants & Masterminds Third Edition.

122091.name: Hareraiser: Finale
122091.description:
User Summary:

Hareraiser: Finale is the second game in which clues could guide the player to a great prize, worth £30,000. The game is much like the first one, but this time it contains not only hares in woods, but also spiders. Hareraiser was never solved.

122092.name: Weather Powers
122092.description:
Publisher's Blurb:

The flash of lightning, the crash of thunder, and the howl of the wind: the elements are at your command with Weather Powers! Call up fierce storms and strike your foes with lightning, or chill them to the bone with an arctic blizzard. Soar upon the wings of the wind and use it to carry others aloft. Dominate and shape the battlefield by controlling the environment, but beware the heavy responsibility that comes with this power and the opportunity to use it. This product is for Mutants & Masterminds Third Edition.

122093.name: Electrical Powers

rpgpodcastepisode.76102: M&M Update: Heroes and Villains Vol 2, Power Profiles and Emerald City Box Set

122093.description:
Publisher's Blurb:

From the thunderbolts of the gods to the energy sustaining the modern world, electricity is a power to reckon with, and Electrical Powers range from hurling bolts of lightning or stunning taser blasts to absorbing and conducting the output of a city's power-grid, or "riding the lightning" by transforming into electricity and traveling in the blink of an eye.

This product is for Mutants & Masterminds Third Edition.

122094.name: Water Powers
122094.description:
Publisher's Blurb:

Some might think so, but Water Powers are no laughing matter: water covers three-quarters of the Earth's surface, makes up the majority of living organisms, and is something we depend upon to survive. Control over this element ranges from the destructive power of tsunamis and water erosion to suffocating spheres and high-pressure blasts. Survive in the ocean depths, form hydrokinetic objects, and summon aquatic and elemental creatures that obey your commands with the powers of water! This product is for Mutants & Masterminds Third Edition.

122095.name: The Game of Lilith
122095.description:
Baby Lilith ventured forth into the world. Now she needs to get back home.

In this game you roll custom dice to obtain different symbols. These symbols are then used to move along paths on the game boards, which will appear as the players advance. In the middle of eacht board, you have the possibility to win cards that will provide you with a bonus symbol.

The goal of the game is to be the first player to reach the center of the final board.

This is a PnP game I created as a gift for the birth of my daughter Lilith.

122096.name: Krieger, Krämer und Kultisten
122096.description:
(from the back of the book)
Each adventuring party meets various NPCs. While many of them remain a random encounter on the way, in the marketplace or in the tavern, others are valuable informants, sinister opponents, loyal friends, or even unexpected allies: the fat host, in whose tavern the party sleeps, a bloodthirsty Orc robber who waylays the group with his band at the fork on the road or the young girl who is in distress of no own fault and asks for help.

Warriors, Merchants and Cultists provides atmospheric descriptions for more than 60 NPCs, and offers numerous adventure ideas and useful boxed stats, which allow a quick adjustment of the stats to the level of the party. Included are essays on culture-specific use of the NPCs outside of the Middle Empire, and helpful information for the design of NPCs in the game: Lists of names, a detailed overview of personal descriptions and a table with soul animals to design encounters on the spot.

122097.name: Things That Go Bump in the Night
122097.description:
UNPUBLISHED PRODUCT




it appears this Item will never be published
this Item has been moved to (Unpublished Products)
there should be no product images submitted to this entry





From Publisher Blurb

Things That Go Bump in the Night a bestiary of monsters and horrific creatures. The book will contain dozens of nightmarish beings for the HERO System 6th Edition. Each write-up will be supported by a detailed history of the folklore behind the legend, as well as suggestions on how to adapt the creature for various genres and power levels.

(The book will be available at GenCon 2012, and should retail in the $15 to $20 range.)
admin comment
this was moved to (Unpublished Products) on August 11, 2016

122098.name: Sphaira
122098.description:
User Summary

Sphaira is a graphical icon-driven adventure game. The back of the box says (translated from French):

"As an archaeologist specialized in paranormal phenomena, your researches have lead you to an isolated region of Peru. During your investigations, you discover a previously unknown cave, you set out to explore it... An irrational fear almost overwhelms you, but you decide to go anyway!

Will you be able to enter the world of Sphaira, refuge of the Atlantid, and accomplish your mission? The survival of the most prestigious human people is in your hands!"

122099.name: Star Trap
122099.description:
User Summary

A graphical, icon-based science-fiction adventure game. Your first trip as junior technician aboard the star freighter Ampelos was uneventful, until now. The captain has been killed, the rest of the crew has barricaded themselves in their quarters, systems are failing all over the ship, and the maintenance robots attack any human they see. You have eight hours to repair the ship before life support shuts down.

122100.name: White Hole
122100.description:
From the publisher's website:

Space station in peril? Check. Warrior aliens with a blood feud? Check. Hand-wavy quantum physics, Star cult zealots, and stupid people desperate to escape? Check, check and check! Welcome to Star Station Sigma, at the edge of the White Hole.

The heroes aboard Star Station Sigma took one look at that dimensional anomaly and they got the hell out of town.

After the “white hole” (that’s what the super-genius science team called it) tore part of the station’s hull clean off, the stupid bastards in charge ordered an evacuation. A few minutes after that, they were headed back to Space Legion territory with FTL drives at maximum. But the white hole had busted the lower deck all to hell, damaging many of the escape pods, so a bunch of people got stranded aboard Star Station Sigma. The losers, mostly.

Those left behind: some junior officers with delusions of competence some hard-drinking pilots who didn’t respond to the alarm quickly enough, maintenance staff (glorified janitors), a few asshole security officers, and a bunch of prisoners from the holding area. Now everyone’s trying to figure out how the hell we’re going to get off this ship. Problem is, the Ax’Tularians hate the Kruk’Chels, the prisoners hate security, and the crew members hate the officers. The station’s orbiting a white hole, and everyone’s trying to kill everybody else, and we’re just a clump of space-waste circling the drain. I should’ve stuck with smuggling.

This playset by Rafael Chandler includes a Stunt Die mechanic for atomizing the station as you play, for added trouble!

122101.name: Skull & Shackles Adventure Path Pawn Collection
122101.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Key monsters and NPCs from the piratical Skull & Shackles Adventure Path come alive on your tabletop with this collection of more than 100 creature pawns for use with the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game or any tabletop fantasy RPG! Printed on sturdy cardstock, each pawn contains a beautiful full-color image of a monster or NPC from the Skull & Shackles campaign, including pirates, sea monsters, cyclopes, merfolk and dozens of unique NPCs that are also suitable to represent player characters. Each cardstock pawn slots into a size-appropriate plastic base from the Pathfinder RPG Bestiary Box, making them easy to mix with traditional metal or plastic miniatures. With multiple pawns for commonly encountered creatures and tons of distinct creature images, the Skull & Shackles Adventure Path Pawn Collection brings the friends and foes of Pathfinder’s pirate campaign alive like never before!

Note: This product does not include bases. It is intended for use with the bases found in the Pathfinder RPG Bestiary Box.

122102.name: Tony Truand
122102.description:
User Summary

A graphical adventure game played in real time. Tony Truand has escaped from prison. Your are inspector Jean Fouche and your mission is to chase after him. You must find clues, and then head to the contral computer and submit them. If you have gathered enough clues, you have won the game.

122103.name: Champions 6th Edition Character Pack (HD Character Pack)
122103.description:
From Publisher Website

All the characters and templates from Champions 6th Edition in Hero Designer format. Includes character sheets for characters, vehicles, and the like. Does not include textual descriptions or illustrations, only HERO System 6th Edition statistics in Hero Designer format.

User Notes

Hero Designer is a piece of software that greatly simplifies the creation of HERO System content by providing templates, error-checking, and a full set of powers, skills, etc., and more.

Hero fans (usually uncredited) often volunteer to turn content from HERO System titles into Hero Designer format. No artwork is included in HD Character Packs.

122104.name: Champions Beyond Character Pack (HD Character Pack)
122104.description:
From Publisher Website

The Hero Designer files for Champions Beyond. All of the characters in the book translated into Hero Designer format.

User Notes

Hero Designer is a piece of software that greatly simplifies the creation of HERO System content by providing templates, error-checking, and a full set of powers, skills, etc., and more.

Hero fans (usually uncredited) often volunteer to turn content from HERO System titles into Hero Designer format. No artwork is included in HD Character Packs.

122105.name: Champions Master Villains Character Pack (HD Character Pack)
122105.description:
From Publisher Website

The Hero Designer files for Champions Villains Volume One: Master Villains. All of the characters in the book translated into Hero Designer format.

User Notes

Hero Designer is a piece of software that greatly simplifies the creation of HERO System content by providing templates, error-checking, and a full set of powers, skills, etc., and more.

Hero fans (usually uncredited) often volunteer to turn content from HERO System titles into Hero Designer format. No artwork is included in HD Character Packs.

122106.name: Champions Powers Character Pack (HD Character Pack)
122106.description:
From Publisher Website

The Hero Designer files for Champions Powers. All of the Powers in the book translated into Hero Designer format.

User Notes

Hero Designer is a piece of software that greatly simplifies the creation of HERO System content by providing templates, error-checking, and a full set of powers, skills, etc., and more.

Hero fans (usually uncredited) often volunteer to turn content from HERO System titles into Hero Designer format. No artwork is included in HD Character Packs.

122107.name: Champions Solo Villains Character Pack (HD Character Pack)
122107.description:
From Publisher Website

The Hero Designer files for Champions Villains Volume Three: Solo Villains. All of the characters in the book translated into Hero Designer format.

User Notes

Even though the print release of Champions Villains Volume Three: Solo Villains has been delayed, the character pack from this title is available. (Solo Villains is also available in pdf.)

Hero Designer is a piece of software that greatly simplifies the creation of HERO System content by providing templates, error-checking, and a full set of powers, skills, etc., and more.

Hero fans (usually uncredited) often volunteer to turn content from HERO System titles into Hero Designer format. No artwork is included in HD Character Packs.

122108.name: Monster of the Week (Beta)
122108.description:
From the publisher's webpage:

There are monsters out there.
Most people don't believe in them, but they're real. Mostly, when someone finds out that monsters are real, that's just before they die.
But some people are mean enough, smart enough, crazy enough, or hurt enough, that they live. They go on a crusade to kill the monsters.
That's who you are.

It could be that you make a stand and defend your hometown from everything evil that comes there.
It could be you take to the road and go hunt them down.
It could be you have magic powers.
It could be that your name came up in prophecies thousands of years ago.

The one sure thing is you aren't gonna go back to your old, safe life.

Monster of the Week is a pen & paper roleplaying game in which you are monster hunters in a world much like ours.

(user addition)
This is the beta version of the core rulebook, released to supporters of the IndieGoGo campaign.

122109.name: Poland Crushed
122109.description:
Having spent the plunder gained from taking over Czechoslovakia a year earlier to further build up the Wehrmacht, Hitler decided it was time for the next step in his Lebensraum plan to reshape Europe. With his new round of threats and bluff failing, Hitler has decided that there is no other alternative than to send in the Panzers!

In Poland Crushed the players take on the role of the German or Polish High Command. Since Poland’s survival is unlikely against the combined might of the German and Russian war machines, they are in a race against time. The German victory is judged on their ability to overwhelm Polish resistance before the Soviets move in for their slice.

As well as the historical scenario and numerous variants, players are encouraged to experiment with what was probably Poland’s best
historical hope of survival - the Southern Stronghold scenario where the army tries to hold onto the region bordering its friend, Romania.

122110.name: High Command: Europe
122110.description:
On September 1st, 1939, the German forces launched the invasion of Poland, unleashing the most devastating conflict in human history. Six years after, the war had come to engulf dozens of nations all over the planet, becoming a true World War.

High Command: Europe is the first game in the High Command Series by Academy Games, a system that brings unique mechanisms into the Second World War setting and that will confront the players with the tough decisions that theatre commanders had to face during the conflict.

In HC: Europe one player leads the Axis forces, trying to make good their early head start and occupying the most vital areas in Europe before the Allied player is able to reverse the tide. Players will have to mobilize and strengthen their armies whilst gathering the resources that are the lifeline of their war effort.

The action-selection mechanism provides for a fast and tense experience, with multiple avenues to consider and no downtime between turns. Also, unlike most wargames, HC: Europe uses no dice, charts or counters.

The game comes with short scenarios so that players can acquire a good grasp of the system, but even the full campaign can be played in less than three hours.

122111.name: Medina
122111.description:
"Embark on an all new adventure through an exotic land dating back to the 8th century.

Awaiting you, as a loyal royal subject of monarch ruled territory Medina, is a heroic opportunity, to bestow many riches including monetary goods, deeper intellect and spiritual awareness. Your ultimate goal is to prevail and insure the Kingdom will be able to survive for another 300 years.

Choose your character and level of difficulty to challenge your best inner Sheikh (or attain the knowledge to become one). Find and collect symbolic quest objects, while escaping the moguls path. Make your way through Medina’s labyrinth maze, listen for your cue, unlock more imperial cities and sequentially present HRH The King with the found quest treasures. Your destiny will be presented upon you, ultimately revealing truths that have eluded generations.

Key game features:

4 challenging and distinct layouts (co-coordinated sub-layouts Coming Soon!!!)

9 game play variations with 3 character choices and 3 levels of difficulty

Numerous transcending quest objects at your finger tips

Challenge others through GameCenter

Timed sequencing

Collect all of the objects and gold pieces to become an Imperial Millennium Master Gamer

Point accumulation Leader Board

Brag to your friends or challenge unknown others through supported Social networking sites, including Facebook and Twitter"

Source: The Developer Website.

122112.name: Monster Shooter: Dual-Stick Mayhem Perfected!
122112.description:
"Monster Shooter is a new free to play top-down action shooter from Gamelion. This is the first shooter that allows experiencing full monster's mayhem to both casual players and hardcore alien exterminators as well. Follow the epic chase in story mode or take your chance in survival of the fittest, top the leader boards, master the ways of annihilation with: shotguns, plasma rifle, electricity gun, grenades, rocket launcher and even the NUKE!"

Source: The Developer Website.

122113.name: Mosaic Mania
122113.description:
User Summary

Mosaic Mania is a logic puzzle game. You will test brain with this game. The objective is to place all time tiles in the correct order and feel the complexity hidden with each tile. The horizontal and vertical numbers show you how many time tiles should be placed in the grid. The value assigned to the rows and columns is what make this game addictive

122114.name: Pauntel's Got Talent
122114.description:
It is the first season of "Pauntels Got Talent" and the competition is really ramping up! You are a badger, attempting to impress the 6 judges in order to get them to vote for you. It’s not as easy as it seems though because the judges are also competing against each other to see which of them gets the most influence over the competition. Make sure you get the right judges on your side or you don’t stand a chance!

Materials: Basic Decktet and 10 markers in each of the six suits. You may use the Excuse to hold the influence tokens collected by the judges.

Pauntel's Got Talent is an indirect trick-taking game largely inspired by Triumvirate (this may be a bit of an understatement). During the each hand player's will play to tricks which will determine which of the judges, represented by the 6 suits, gains influence for that round. At the end of each hand player's can pledge one card face down. The player who pledges more cards to any given suit wins the favor of that judge and any influence, or points, they are worth.

boardgamecompilation.157820: Escape: The Curse of the Temple – Big Box

122115.description:
Escape: The Pit is a set of promotional items for Escape, first given to Kickstarter backers and distributed later via other venues.

"The Pit" adds a new potential room to the game. In "The Pit", a player may activate two gems in the pit, but only by rolling five curses! This means he will definitely need assistance from another player to get back out of the pit again, since all five of his dice will be locked.

This promo also adds a couple new curse tiles to the game. When playing with curse tiles, the new curses add variety to the curses that might arise. "Lost Treasure" will do exactly what it sounds like it would do: You lose a treasure (if you are playing with treasures). If you don't have a treasure, lucky you! "Really Cursed" forces you to draw two curses for the remainder of the game whenever you get cursed!
122115.name: Escape: The Curse of the Temple – The Pit

113294.name: Escape: The Curse of the Temple

122116.name: The Game Master: A Guide to the Art and Theory of Roleplaying
122116.description:
From the publisher:

The Game Master is an eBook about roleplaying games. It is for anybody who runs or is thinking about running RPGs to discover how to consistently produce games that work and avoid train-wreck campaigns, and to gain a deeper appreciation of the special nature of RPGs as both a literary form and a type of entertainment.

It is provided on a “Pay What You Want” basis, and is free to distribute. Contributions to the author are heartily encouraged if you find the book useful, but are not required.

122117.name: RotVar!
122117.description:
RotVar! is a board game where two or more players challenge each other directly on the battlefield.
Play as the brave Humans or the noble Arverians, the keepers of the forest.
The game consists in a series of turns where the two factions alternating between quest and battles to the death.
Fight battles that involve dozens of friends or play face to face with your enemy!
Complete missions to earn gold, which is useful to buy all that you need to crush the enemy forces:
potions, weapons, armor, spells and skills.
Earn fame, useful to recruiting new characters to make your party more complete and destructive.
